p: The few clear risk factors identified in children include age and underlying medical conditions. Among available data for 745 hospitalized children less than 18 years old with confirmed COVID-19, 147 (range of 5.7%–20.0%) required intensive care unit admission of whom 95 were children aged less than 1 year [ 8]. In a report of 345 pediatric cases, 80 (23%) had at least one underlying condition. The most common were chronic lung disease (including asthma) in 40, cardiovascular disease in 25 and immunosuppression in 10 [ 8]. Furthermore, among 2143 pediatric patients with COVID-19 reported to China’s CDC young children aged 1–5 years represented 7.3%, and this increased in infants less than 1 year of age to reach 10.6%.17.
